ai-kv17.9:0.4_0: On the nearness of the Ganges
ai-kv17.9:1.2_0: “He gave gifts to the Saṅgha of mendicants.”
ai-kv17.9:1.4_0: It’s not worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of greeting with joined palms, and is the supreme field of merit for the world.
ai-kv17.9:1.6_0: If the Sangha is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of greeting with joined palms, and is the supreme field of merit for the world.
ai-kv17.9:1.7_0: “He gave gifts to the Saṅgha of mendicants.”
ai-kv17.9:2.2_0: “He gave gifts to the Saṅgha of mendicants.”
ai-kv17.9:2.4_0: Doesn’t the four pairs of persons?
ai-kv17.9:2.6_0: If a pair of men were struck by the Buddha, the four pairs of persons said:
ai-kv17.9:2.7_0: “He gave gifts to the Saṅgha of mendicants.”
ai-kv17.9:3.2_0: “He gave gifts to the Saṅgha of mendicants.”
ai-kv17.9:3.5_0: “Give them to the Sangha, Gotamī, when you have given them to you, you will have offered them to.”
ai-kv17.9:3.8_0: what’s given to the Sangha is very fruitful.
ai-kv17.9:4.2_0: “He gave gifts to the Saṅgha of mendicants.”
ai-kv17.9:4.4_0: Didn’t you not tell the Buddha,
ai-kv17.9:5.4_0: where is a gift very fruitful?”
ai-kv17.9:6.2_0: and four established in the fruit.
ai-kv17.9:6.3_0: this is the Saṅgha, he is the straightst,
ai-kv17.9:7.4_0: what is given to the Saṅgha is very fruitful.
ai-kv17.9:8.3_0: These are the best of men, not even a single one,
ai-kv17.9:9.1_0: And Sudinna was taken for him to hear it.
ai-kv17.9:9.2_0: who gives a gift to the Saṅgha,
ai-kv17.9:9.3_0: that offering is established in the Community.
ai-kv17.9:9.4_0: and is praised by those who know the world.
ai-kv17.9:10.2_0: live in the world full of joy.
ai-kv17.9:10.3_0: They’ve driven out the stain of stinginess, root and all,
ai-kv17.9:10.4_0: blameless, they go to a heavenly place.”
ai-kv17.9:11.3_0: what’s given to the Sangha is very fruitful.
ai-kv17.9:11.4_0: The discussion of the Sangha is not to be spoken of in the Sangha.
